trans-unit.source: Open files and folders with a picker
trans-unit.target: Open files and folders with a picker

trans-unit.source: Access files and folders by letting the user interact with a picker.
trans-unit.target: Access files and folders by letting the user interact with a picker.

trans-unit.source: You can use the FileOpenPicker and FileSavePicker classes to gain access to files, and the FolderPicker to gain access to a folder.
trans-unit.target: You can use the FileOpenPicker and FileSavePicker classes to gain access to files, and the FolderPicker to gain access to a folder.

trans-unit.source: Open files and folders with a picker
trans-unit.target: Open files and folders with a picker

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: FileOpenPicker
trans-unit.target: FileOpenPicker

trans-unit.source: FolderPicker
trans-unit.target: FolderPicker

trans-unit.source: StorageFile
trans-unit.target: StorageFile

trans-unit.source: Access files and folders by letting the user interact with a picker.
trans-unit.target: Access files and folders by letting the user interact with a picker.

trans-unit.source: You can use the [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) and [**FileSavePicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207871) classes to gain access to files, and the [**FolderPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207881) to gain access to a folder.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) and [**FileSavePicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207871) classes to gain access to files, and the [**FolderPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207881) to gain access to a folder.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Also see the [File picker sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619994).
trans-unit.target: **Note** Also see the [File picker sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619994).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps
trans-unit.target: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

trans-unit.source: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C# or Visual Basic, see [Call asynchronous APIs in C# or Visual Basic](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187337).
trans-unit.target: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C# or Visual Basic, see [Call asynchronous APIs in C# or Visual Basic](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187337).

trans-unit.source: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see [Asynchronous programming in C++](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187334).
trans-unit.target: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see [Asynchronous programming in C++](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187334).

trans-unit.source: Access permissions to the location
trans-unit.target: Access permissions to the location

trans-unit.source: See [File access permissions](file-access-permissions.md).
trans-unit.target: See [File access permissions](file-access-permissions.md).

trans-unit.source: File picker UI
trans-unit.target: File picker UI

trans-unit.source: A file picker displays information to orient users and to provide a consistent experience when users open or save files.
trans-unit.target: A file picker displays information to orient users and to provide a consistent experience when users open or save files.

trans-unit.source: That information includes:
trans-unit.target: That information includes:

trans-unit.source: The current location
trans-unit.target: The current location

trans-unit.source: The item or items that the user picked
trans-unit.target: The item or items that the user picked

trans-unit.source: A tree of locations that the user can browse to.
trans-unit.target: A tree of locations that the user can browse to.

trans-unit.source: These locations include file system locations—such as the Music or Downloads folder—as well as apps that implement the file picker contract (such as Camera, Photos, and Microsoft OneDrive).
trans-unit.target: These locations include file system locations—such as the Music or Downloads folder—as well as apps that implement the file picker contract (such as Camera, Photos, and Microsoft OneDrive).

trans-unit.source: An email app might display a file picker so that the user can pick attachments.
trans-unit.target: An email app might display a file picker so that the user can pick attachments.

trans-unit.source: a file picker with two files picked to be opened.
trans-unit.target: a file picker with two files picked to be opened.

trans-unit.source: How pickers work
trans-unit.target: How pickers work

trans-unit.source: Through a picker, your app can gain access to files and folders on the user's system.
trans-unit.target: Through a picker, your app can gain access to files and folders on the user's system.

trans-unit.source: Through the picker, the user browses their system to pick files (or folders) to open or save to.
trans-unit.target: Through the picker, the user browses their system to pick files (or folders) to open or save to.

trans-unit.source: Your app receives those picks as [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) and [**StorageFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227230) objects, which you can then operate on.
trans-unit.target: Your app receives those picks as [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) and [**StorageFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227230) objects, which you can then operate on.

trans-unit.source: The picker uses a single, unified interface to let the user pick files and folders from the files system or from other apps.
trans-unit.target: The picker uses a single, unified interface to let the user pick files and folders from the files system or from other apps.

trans-unit.source: Files picked from other apps are like files from the file system: they are returned as [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) objects.
trans-unit.target: Files picked from other apps are like files from the file system: they are returned as [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) objects.

trans-unit.source: In general, your app can operate on them in the same ways as other such objects.
trans-unit.target: In general, your app can operate on them in the same ways as other such objects.

trans-unit.source: Other apps make files available by participating in file picker contracts.
trans-unit.target: Other apps make files available by participating in file picker contracts.

trans-unit.source: If you want your app to provide files, a save location, or file updates to other apps, see [Integrating with file picker contracts](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465192).
trans-unit.target: If you want your app to provide files, a save location, or file updates to other apps, see [Integrating with file picker contracts](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465192).

trans-unit.source: For example, you might call the file picker in your app so that your user can open a file.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might call the file picker in your app so that your user can open a file.

trans-unit.source: This makes your app the calling app.
trans-unit.target: This makes your app the calling app.

trans-unit.source: The file picker interacts with the system and/or other apps to let the user navigate and pick the file.
trans-unit.target: The file picker interacts with the system and/or other apps to let the user navigate and pick the file.

trans-unit.source: When your user chooses a file, the file picker returns that file to your app.
trans-unit.target: When your user chooses a file, the file picker returns that file to your app.

trans-unit.source: Here's the process for the case where the user chooses a file from another app, such as OneDrive.
trans-unit.target: Here's the process for the case where the user chooses a file from another app, such as OneDrive.

trans-unit.source: In this case OneDrive is the providing app.
trans-unit.target: In this case OneDrive is the providing app.

trans-unit.source: a daigram that shows the process of one app getting a file to open from another app using the file picker as an interface bewteen the two apps.
trans-unit.target: a daigram that shows the process of one app getting a file to open from another app using the file picker as an interface bewteen the two apps.

trans-unit.source: Pick a single file to open it: complete code listing
trans-unit.target: Pick a single file to open it: complete code listing

trans-unit.source: For code to pick multiple files, see the [File picker sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619994).
trans-unit.target: For code to pick multiple files, see the [File picker sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619994).

trans-unit.source: Pick a single file to open it: step-by-step
trans-unit.target: Pick a single file to open it: step-by-step

trans-unit.source: Using a file picker involves creating and customizing a file picker object, and then showing the file picker so the user can pick one or more items.
trans-unit.target: Using a file picker involves creating and customizing a file picker object, and then showing the file picker so the user can pick one or more items.

trans-unit.source: Create and customize a FileOpenPicker
trans-unit.target: Create and customize a FileOpenPicker

trans-unit.source: Set properties on the file picker object that are relevant to your users and your app.
trans-unit.target: Set properties on the file picker object that are relevant to your users and your app.

trans-unit.source: For guidelines to help you decide how to customize the file picker, see [Guidelines and checklist for file pickers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465182).
trans-unit.target: For guidelines to help you decide how to customize the file picker, see [Guidelines and checklist for file pickers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465182).

trans-unit.source: This example creates a rich, visual display of pictures in a convenient location that the user can pick from by setting three properties: [**ViewMode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207855), [**SuggestedStartLocation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207854), and [**FileTypeFilter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207850).
trans-unit.target: This example creates a rich, visual display of pictures in a convenient location that the user can pick from by setting three properties: [**ViewMode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207855), [**SuggestedStartLocation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207854), and [**FileTypeFilter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207850).

trans-unit.source: Setting [**ViewMode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207855) to the **Thumbnail** [**PickerViewMode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.storage.pickers.pickerviewmode.aspx#thumbnail) enum value creates a rich, visual display by using picture thumbnails to represent files in the file picker.
trans-unit.target: Setting [**ViewMode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207855) to the **Thumbnail** [**PickerViewMode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.storage.pickers.pickerviewmode.aspx#thumbnail) enum value creates a rich, visual display by using picture thumbnails to represent files in the file picker.

trans-unit.source: Do this for picking visual files such as pictures or videos.
trans-unit.target: Do this for picking visual files such as pictures or videos.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, use [**PickerViewMode.List**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.storage.pickers.pickerviewmode.aspx#list).
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, use [**PickerViewMode.List**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.storage.pickers.pickerviewmode.aspx#list).

trans-unit.source: A hypothetical email app with **Attach Picture or Video** and **Attach Document** features would set the **ViewMode** appropriate to the feature before showing the file picker.
trans-unit.target: A hypothetical email app with **Attach Picture or Video** and **Attach Document** features would set the **ViewMode** appropriate to the feature before showing the file picker.

trans-unit.source: Setting [**SuggestedStartLocation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207854) to Pictures using [**PickerLocationId.PicturesLibrary**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207890) starts the user in a location where they're likely to find pictures.
trans-unit.target: Setting [**SuggestedStartLocation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207854) to Pictures using [**PickerLocationId.PicturesLibrary**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207890) starts the user in a location where they're likely to find pictures.

trans-unit.source: Set **SuggestedStartLocation** to a location appropriate for the type of file being picked, for example Music, Pictures, Videos, or Documents.
trans-unit.target: Set **SuggestedStartLocation** to a location appropriate for the type of file being picked, for example Music, Pictures, Videos, or Documents.

trans-unit.source: From the start location, the user can navigate to other locations.
trans-unit.target: From the start location, the user can navigate to other locations.

trans-unit.source: Using [**FileTypeFilter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207850) to specify file types keeps the user focused on picking files that are relevant.
trans-unit.target: Using [**FileTypeFilter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207850) to specify file types keeps the user focused on picking files that are relevant.

trans-unit.source: To replace previous file types in the **FileTypeFilter** with new entries, use [**ReplaceAll**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207844) instead of [**Add**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207834).
trans-unit.target: To replace previous file types in the **FileTypeFilter** with new entries, use [**ReplaceAll**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207844) instead of [**Add**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207834).

trans-unit.source: Show the FileOpenPicker
trans-unit.target: Show the FileOpenPicker

trans-unit.source: To pick a single file
trans-unit.target: To pick a single file

trans-unit.source: Pick a folder: complete code listing
trans-unit.target: Pick a folder: complete code listing

trans-unit.source: **Tip** Whenever your app accesses a file or folder through a picker, add it to your app's [**FutureAccessList**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207457) or [**MostRecentlyUsedList**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207458) to keep track of it.
trans-unit.target: **Tip** Whenever your app accesses a file or folder through a picker, add it to your app's [**FutureAccessList**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207457) or [**MostRecentlyUsedList**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207458) to keep track of it.

trans-unit.source: You can learn more about using these lists in [How to track recently-used files and folders](how-to-track-recently-used-files-and-folders.md).
trans-unit.target: You can learn more about using these lists in [How to track recently-used files and folders](how-to-track-recently-used-files-and-folders.md).
